section.title: Past simple: regular verbs
section.sectiontitle: In the Past simple, for most regular verbs add -ed. For example: work – worked; talk – talked; start – started.
section.text1a: I worked as an engineer at a big company.
section.text2a: She talked a lot at the party.
section.sectiontitle2: In the Past simple, regular verbs ending in -e add -d. For example: live – lived; hate – hated; love – loved.
section.text3a: I lived in Italy for five years.

section.title: Past simple: regular verbs
section.sectiontitle: In the Past simple, regular verbs which end in a consonant (b, c, d, f, etc.) + -y, we change the -y to -ied. For example: marry – married; study – studied.
section.sectiontitle2: We sometimes use yesterday, (two, three, etc. years) ago and last night/week/month with the Past simple.
